summary: This bill, the Stop Subsidizing Multimillion Dollar Corporate Bonuses Act, seeks to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to restrict deductions for excessive employee remuneration. It expands the definition of 'covered individual' and modifies the definition of a 'publicly held corporation.' The bill grants the Secretary of the Treasury regulatory authority and specifies its effective date as taxable years beginning after December 31, 2024.
